title: Firing the Rockets

children.value: An artificial satellite travels in a circular orbit about the Earth. Its rocket engine is then fired and produces a force on the satellite exactly equal and opposite to that exerted by the Earth's gravitational field.
How would the satellite would then start to move?

choices.value: Along a spiral path towards the Earth's surface.
Along a tangent to the orbit.
Along the line joining it to the centre of the Earth (i.e. radially).
In a circular orbit with a shorter period.
In a circular orbit with a longer period.
